description: This course provides a comprehensive overview of the fundamental concepts and theories in psychology. Students will explore various branches of psychology, including cognitive, developmental, social, and clinical psychology. Key topics include the biological basis of behavior, learning and memory, perception, personality theories, psychological disorders, and therapeutic approaches.

courses.title: Developmental Psychology

overviewPoints.heading: Theoretical Frameworks
overviewPoints.content: Students will study major developmental theories, including Piaget’s cognitive development theory and Erikson’s psychosocial stages, to understand how individuals grow and change over time.

overviewPoints.heading: Life Stage Challenges
overviewPoints.content: The course will highlight significant challenges and transitions faced at different life stages, such as adolescence and aging, and their implications for mental health and well-being.

courses.description: This course explores human development from infancy to adulthood, focusing on cognitive, emotional, and social growth. Students will examine key theories, milestones, and the influence of culture and environment on development.

lessons.title: Cognitive Development in Childhood
lessons.description: This lesson focuses on the stages of cognitive development proposed by Jean Piaget. Students will learn how children perceive the world differently at various ages and the implications for learning and education.

questions.question: Which of the following stages is NOT part of Piaget's cognitive development theory?
According to Piaget, what is the primary cognitive skill developed during the sensorimotor stage?
What is a key factor in identity formation during adolescence, according to Erikson?

lessons.title: Cognitive Development in Adulthoodhood
lessons.description: This lesson focuses on the stages of cognitive development proposed by Jean Piaget. Students will learn how children perceive the world differently at various ages and the implications for learning and education.

courses.title: Abnormal Psychology

overviewPoints.heading: Disorder Classification
overviewPoints.content: Students will explore the DSM-5 diagnostic criteria to categorize and understand a range of psychological disorders, from anxiety and mood disorders to personality disorders.

overviewPoints.heading: Treatment Modalities
overviewPoints.content: The course will examine various treatment options, including psychotherapy and pharmacotherapy, and discuss their effectiveness in addressing mental health challenges.

courses.description: This course covers the study of psychological disorders, including their classification, diagnosis, and treatment. Students will analyze various conditions, therapeutic approaches, and the societal impacts of mental health issues.

lessons.title: Anxiety Disorders: Symptoms and Treatments
lessons.description: This lesson provides an overview of various anxiety disorders, their symptoms, and the latest treatment approaches, including cognitive-behavioral therapy and medication.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common symptom of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD)?
options: Intense fear of a specific object or situation
Persistent worry about multiple life areas
questions.correctAnswer: Persistent worry about multiple life areas

questions.question: What is the primary treatment method for anxiety disorders that involves changing negative thought patterns?
